Sentencas: Sn-NiO-Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 (SDC) is synthesized as an anode material for solid oxide fuel cells with H-2 and dry methane as fuels.
Titulo: Effect of Sn addition on improving the stability of Ni-Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 anode material for solid oxide fuel cells fed with dry CH4

Sentencas: Sn-Ni alloy is formed after reduction.
Titulo: Effect of Sn addition on improving the stability of Ni-Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 anode material for solid oxide fuel cells fed with dry CH4

Sentencas: The performances of anode-supported single cells with a configuration of Sn-Ni-SDC vertical bar SDC vertical bar Ba0.5Sr0.5Co0.8Fe0.2O3-delta are investigated in the range of 600-700 degrees C. With increasing Sn content of the anode, the performances of the cells fed with H-2 and dry methane both decrease slightly, indicating a reduced anodic catalytic activity.
Titulo: Effect of Sn addition on improving the stability of Ni-Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 anode material for solid oxide fuel cells fed with dry CH4

Sentencas: However, the stability of the cell with dry methane as fuel improves remarkably with the addition of Sn due to the suppression of carbon deposition on the anode.
Titulo: Effect of Sn addition on improving the stability of Ni-Ce0.8Sm0.2O1.9 anode material for solid oxide fuel cells fed with dry CH4
